intro: Aphyllodium australiense, commonly known as the slender flatworts, is a flowering plant species native to Australia. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its small, clustered flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as woodland floors and along stream banks. Its leaves are narrow and often have a bluish-green hue, while its stems are wiry and slightly hairy. Aphyllodium australiense is a low-growing perennial that plays a role in stabilizing soil in its native habitat.
